page.title: 15FARMING.
page.content: This area is hilly, almost mountainous at Craswall,and this affects the{type of farming.}Most people in this area are employed as farmers dealing in{sheep}as fatstock. {Lambing}takes place around February and{shearing}during June.{Dipping}has to be carried out before August 10th as laid down by the Ministry of Agriculture. Quite a few farmers describe themselves as having mixed farms,some keeping{beef herds.}Like most farms anywhere they all keep horses,chickens and geese. The average size farm around here is about{100 acres}with quite small fields, mainly hedged.A lot of these fields are kept as rough pasture though some grass is sown for silage and hay.
